summary:
Entrepreneur, Financial Director, CFO, Business Development, Program and Project Management, Transformation Management, Shared Services Optimization, Startup Advice, Sparring Partner.

Rob is an entrepreneur, and, thanks to his extensive experience, perseverance and pleasant personality, he is used to guiding management challenges in the right direction. Rob is reliable, agile, structured and a collaborator. Aware of the importance of futureproofing, always passionate about developing people and companies.

Professional experience

After 17 years at PWC, Rob has been working in the corporate world for about 20 years in senior Finance positions, such as CFO of Adecco Groep Nederland and a very wide range of Finance positions at KPN and Getronics. In addition to in-depth Hardcore Financial experience, Rob has also had to deal with almost all aspects of business and business operations at these companies and also in realizing his Startup GLADDERR.com. Rob is a sparring partner from strategy determination to finding and implementing the best operational solutions.

Industry experience

IT-Tech, Telecom, Manufacturing and Trading companies in Food, Automotive, Paper, Pharmaceutical and Cosmetics, Advertising & media, Temporary employment industry, Human resource services. Finance and Holding companies, Recreation.

Specific experience, a few examples of transformation, restructuring, integration (organizational, financial, fiscal, IT, motivation)

•	Financial Advisor, amongst others a recreation park, a Tech scale-up and a hospital 
•	CFO Adecco Group Netherlands and senior Finance positions at KPN and Getronics.
•	Design and implementation of financial management models and reports.
•	Implementation of ERP system.
•	Project to guarantee continuity of automated data processing from the user side in the migration of an extensive IT landscape.
•	Adaptation of organisation, processes, and systems to new legislation such as the Balanced Labor Market Act (WAB) as of 1-1-2020.
•	Coordination of a transformation office aimed at realizing the desired automation in the short and long term.
•	Optimization and assurance of AO – IC from internal and external regulations (compliance).
•	Setup and optimization of shared service centers for financial and operational activities.
•	Strategic and operational transformation as a result of the Covid-19 crisis.

I am available for interesting part-time assignments. Feel free to contact me for a no-obligation conversation, 0031 (0) 653256638.

Deze doelstellingen zijn nader beschreven in een Project Initiatie Document (“PID”) en uitgesplitst in concrete te realiseren eindproducten. profile_positions.description:
Reporting to the CFO KPN ITS (previously KPN Corporate Market) member FMT.

The Shared Service Center of KPN ITS is responsible for the following tasks:
•	Central Procurement (PO processing, part of the P2P chain)
•	Customer contract administration (O2C chain)
•	Preparing invoicing and billing (O2C chain)
•	Credit Control and Collections (O2C chain)
•	Master data management (all company chains)
•	Finance IT demand (support role: “translating IT demand from the process owners to the IT organisation”)
•	Financial Accounting (Acc. Part of the R2R chain and Accounts Payable part of the P2P chain)
•	Standard Reporting (part of the R2R chain)

The SSC had 250 employees as of 1 January 2013 and 125 employees after the split. 6 direct reports and 6+ project managers. Key was continuous improvement and service management & governance.
Extensive transformations that the KPN Corporate Market BV SSC has undergone under my leadership included:
•	Implementation of ServiceNow.
•	The integration (“sailing in”) of 3 major KPN business units in the “old Getronics environment” from an unclear KPN IT landscape.
•	All customer contract administrations and invoicing departments have been taken out of operation and brought under the control of the SSC and subsequently uniformed where possible (Project Heartbeat).
•	The Finance organization has been redesigned (OFO).
•	Rebranding of the KPN CM BV company including legal and administrative changes.
•	An investigation and decision-making on possible outsourcing of the SSC to India.
•	Separating a business unit within 1 SAP template in connection with. the sale of a business unit (Indiana).
•	Broad optimization of processes (ITS Finance)
•	Splitting up SAP to return business units to the KPN BV organization (SCOPE).
•	The organizational split of the SSC to transfer the part that went back to KPN.

profile_positions.description:
Reporting to the Steering Committee, consisting of members of the Board of Getronics Nederland and member of the Program MT.

Responsibilities and achieved results
•	As part of the programme “One Getronics Nederland organisation” I was in charge of the F&A project “One Finance World” with the following key objectives: 
•	Migration of 16 general ledgers (16 companies, legal entities) to one SAP environment
•	Standardizing of the F&A processes with an Internal Control Framework for 4 company typologies and one Central Finance function
•	Realisation of new business orientated management information (” Commercial Financial reporting” Revenue, CoR and Gross Margin per customer, per transaction-type etc.)
•	Establishing a new Country Finance & Administration organisation with new job descriptions etc.
•	It was a Matrix organisation with the following direct reports (12):
•	Team leaders Implementation to migrate each company to the one SAP template
•	Team leaders Design & Acceptation for the several F&A processes, master data procedures and conversions
•	Set up the “Financial Governance Model”: developed, recorded, committed and implemented. 
A large complex organisation requires proper financial and operational reporting in line with the Operational Governance Model. For each accountable manager or unit, the part where he or she is responsible for, should be accurately and reliably reported.  A Financial Governance Model describes the “booking rules” of the administration towards, among others, cost- and profit centers, WBS (work break down structures in ERP systems), allocation principals etc., to compose these relevant reports. 
•	Ensuring the co-operation with the ICTO organisation (SAP consulting, interface realisation, testing and implementation).

Reporting to the General Manager of Getronics Nederland (hierarchic) and CFO Getronics NV (functional), Member of the Getronics NL MT.

In May 1999 Getronics Nederland BV consisted of several independent operating units (independent private companies under own label). In 2000, they were reorganised into 6 divisions:
•	Infrastructure Solutions
•	Infrastructure Projects
•	Telecom Solutions
•	HR Solutions
•	Business Solutions
•	Consulting

Wang Global was acquired by Getronics NV at the end of May 1999 (Wang Global was truly International and 2x larger than Getronics). During that period, the operational management did not establish a good project organization to manage the various operational integrations in such a way that the Back-Office processes could be financially / administratively reliably executed.
